Description: Bearings, 47mm OD, 35mm ID, 7mm Thickness. 6pck on aliexpress seemed to be the cheapest price, though that is on sale so if you are reading this and it is no longer on sale anymore, there is an amazon link with a constant 15.99 price, which I actually sourced.
Most ESP32 variants should do as long as they have 36 or more GPIO pins. In this example I am using an ESP32-S3 N18R8
4 Wire, 1.8Deg per Step, with 20 N*cm of torque per phase at a max current of 350mAh (0.35A). RoHS certified.

Stepper Motor Driver, 1.2A, 5 Step resolutions, Adjustable maximum current output. Overheat Thermal shutdown and crossover-current protection. Comes in a pack of 5 for the cheapest sourcing price included both amazon link that had a stable price of 10.19. along with an aliexpress link which often goes on sale for cheaper but can sometimes be 13.95. The price listed is the aliexpress link while on sale
Buck converter to step down the 12v for the steppers to 5v for the other electronics like the esp and the drivers.
Connectors for the steppers, will allow for much easier building and protoyping
Power Supply for the arm. Comes with EU plug, but I have so many C14 power cables it isnt funny. Should not be a problem.
Extrutions for the base of the arm. Will allow for the arm to be mounted almost anywhere or stand alone when the end effector is within a certain radius.
Countersunk M4 screws for connecting the extrutions to Robot Base
BHCS M4 screws for connecting the extrutions to the base
T-Nuts for connecting extrutions to robot base
Wire for extention cables for the Stepper Motors
